Class NoisePowerSpectrum_

  • java.lang.Object
    • NoisePowerSpectrum_
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter

    public class NoisePowerSpectrum_
extends java.lang.Object
implements ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter
    An ImageJ plugin to calculate the noise power spectrum of a CT image or stack of images.

      • setup

        public int setup(java.lang.String arg,
                 ij.ImagePlus imp)
        This method is automatically run by ImageJ when the plugin is called. If there is no ROI set then the whole image is selected as an ROI.
        Specified by:
        setup in interface ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter
        Parameters:
        arg - If default then analysis is run with default options. If a value then this is used as the radius of the ROIs. If empty then the user is prompted for the calculation options.
        imp - Passed to the routine automatically by ImageJ.
        Returns:
        DONE if unsuccessful; DOES_ALL if complete

      • run

        public void run(ij.process.ImageProcessor ip)
        This method is called automatically by ImageJ once the setup method has completed. The centre of the main ROI set in the setup method is used as a reference location. The ensembleNPS method is run on either the stack or single image depending on the options the user has chosen. The 2D ensemble NPS is multiplied by:

        dx * dy / (M * Nx * Ny)

        where dx and dy are the pixel dimensions in the x and y directions (mm), M is the number if records and Nx and Ny the x, y pixel dimensions of the record.

        The ensemble NPS is displayed and a one-dimensional radial NPS calculated, plotted and written to the ImageJ log.
        Specified by:
        run in interface ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter
        Parameters:
        ip - The ImageProcessor that is passed to this method automatically by ImageJ

      • ensembleNPS

        private double[][] ensembleNPS(ij.process.ImageProcessor im_proc,
                               double radius_px,
                               ij.measure.Calibration cal,
                               double[] centre,
                               ij.gui.Overlay overlay)
        Method to calculate the ensemble 2D NPS from an image using a series of square record ROIs arranged around the perimeter of a circle with specified centre and radius. For each of these records:
        • A 2D second-order polynomial fit is carried out and subtracted to remove any signal
        • The record is Fourier transformed, resulting in a 2D array of complex numbers
        • The magnitude of each complex value is calculated and squared
        • This result is added to the ensemble
        Parameters:
        im_proc - The image data for analysis
        radius_px - The radius to use when positioning the record ROIs
        cal - The pixel calibration of the image
        centre - The coordinates of the centre of the circle on the perimeter of which the record ROIs are to be placed
        overlay - The overlay that will display each record ROI
        Returns:
        The ensemble 2D NPS

      • multiply2dDoubleArray

        private static double[][] multiply2dDoubleArray(double[][] values,
                                                double mult_val)
        Method to multiply every element in a 2D double array by a value.

      • rebinNPS

        private NoisePowerSpectrum_.NPS_result rebinNPS(double[] freq,
                                                double[] val,
                                                double f_inc,
                                                double f_bin)
        Method to rebin NPS data to a regular frequency spacing.
        Parameters:
        freq - The raw frequency data
        val - The raw value data
        f_inc - The frequency increments of the rebinned NPS
        f_bin - The width of the frequency bin to use to find values to average at each binned frequency
        Returns:
        The rebinned array results
